channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: California judge recommends disbarment of pro-Trump attorney John Eastman
item.description: A California judge found that attorney John Eastman committed "exceptionally serious ethical violations" in his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 election and recommended disbarment.
item.content:encoded:
A California judge found that attorney John Eastman committed "exceptionally serious ethical violations" in his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 election and recommended disbarment.

(Image credit: Jae C. Hong)
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach

item.title: An appeals court says 'undated' Pennsylvania ballots don't count
item.description: A federal appeals panel says mailed ballots arriving on time but in envelopes without dates handwritten by Pennsylvania voters shouldn't be counted. This case is expected to reach the Supreme Court.
item.content:encoded:
A federal appeals panel says mailed ballots arriving on time but in envelopes without dates handwritten by Pennsylvania voters shouldn't be counted. This case is expected to reach the Supreme Court.

(Image credit: Matt Slocum)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: Centrist former Sen. Joseph Lieberman has died at 82
item.description: As Al Gore's running mate in 2000, Lieberman became the first Jewish candidate on a presidential ticket of one of the two major parties. He later became an independent and was a leader of No Labels.
item.content:encoded:
As Al Gore's running mate in 2000, Lieberman became the first Jewish candidate on a presidential ticket of one of the two major parties. He later became an independent and was a leader of No Labels.

(Image credit: Tom Williams)
item.dc:creator: Washington Desk

item.title: An Arizona lawmaker announced she was getting an abortion. Here's what happened next
item.description: State Sen. Eva Burch hopes her experiences will convince her colleagues to leave abortion access up to doctors — and Arizona voters — this fall.
item.content:encoded:
State Sen. Eva Burch hopes her experiences will convince her colleagues to leave abortion access up to doctors — and Arizona voters — this fall.

(Image credit: Ross D. Franklin)
item.dc:creator: Wayne Schutsky

item.title: Life Without a Government in Haiti
item.description: Haiti is the middle of a crisis and is without a government as gangs in Port-au-Prince prevent one. But some parts of Haiti have lived without a functioning government for so long they cannot remember what it's like to have one. Our reporter in Haiti takes us to one such village.
item.content:encoded: Haiti is the middle of a crisis and is without a government as gangs in Port-au-Prince prevent one. But some parts of Haiti have lived without a functioning government for so long they cannot remember what it's like to have one. Our reporter in Haiti takes us to one such village.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Best-selling psychologist of 'Thinking, Fast and Slow,' dies at 90
item.description: One of the founders of behavioral economics, who incorporated human quirks into the study of how people make economic decisions, has died. Daniel Kahneman was 90.
item.content:encoded:
One of the founders of behavioral economics, who incorporated human quirks into the study of how people make economic decisions, has died. Daniel Kahneman was 90.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Cash-strapped Trump is now selling $60 Bibles, U.S. Constitution included
item.description: The "God Bless The USA" Bible is inspired by the Lee Greenwood anthem and includes copies of the nation's founding documents. Trump launched it ahead of Easter as his financial woes mount.
item.content:encoded:
The "God Bless The USA" Bible is inspired by the Lee Greenwood anthem and includes copies of the nation's founding documents. Trump launched it ahead of Easter as his financial woes mount.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Here's what to know about dengue, as Puerto Rico declares a public health emergency
item.description: Most people with dengue will show no signs of infection or experience only mild symptoms, but in rare cases infections can become severe and potentially fatal.
item.content:encoded:
Most people with dengue will show no signs of infection or experience only mild symptoms, but in rare cases infections can become severe and potentially fatal.

(Image credit: Luis Robayo)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Kickoffs will look radically different in the NFL next year. Here's how and why
item.description: For years, the NFL has tweaked kickoff rules to reduce injuries, resulting in kickoffs that were safer but more boring. The changes aim to re-introduce excitement while keeping injuries low.
item.content:encoded:
For years, the NFL has tweaked kickoff rules to reduce injuries, resulting in kickoffs that were safer but more boring. The changes aim to re-introduce excitement while keeping injuries low.

(Image credit: Charlie Riedel)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Baltimore's bridge collapse is expected to disrupt supply chains
item.description: The Port of Baltimore handles high volumes of auto imports, so while it's at a standstill, some cars and trucks will have to be diverted to other ports, which could raise costs.
item.content:encoded:
The Port of Baltimore handles high volumes of auto imports, so while it's at a standstill, some cars and trucks will have to be diverted to other ports, which could raise costs.

(Image credit: Al Drago)
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam
